---
  title: "Data"
---


To import a .csv file directly from the web into RStudio, such as one of the ones below, we use the following command:

`read.csv("web address")`


For instance, to import the governors data file, and give it the name `gov`, we enter the following at the console prompt in RStudio (you can copy and paste!):

```
gov = read.csv("https://mphitchman.com/stats/data/governors.csv")
```

In general, when you are importing a .csv file from the web, I encourage you to right click on the link to copy the link address, and then paste it (between quotes!) in the `read.csv("")` command.
  
  - <a href="data/softball.csv">softball.csv</a>
  - <a href="data/chopin.csv">chopin.csv</a>
  - <a href="data/governors.csv">governors.csv</a>
  - <a href="data/oscars.csv">oscars data (long form)</a>
  - <a href="data/oscars2.csv">oscars data (wide form)</a>
  - <a href="data/hurricanes.csv">hurricanes.csv</a>
  - <a href="data/survey_cleaned_F21">survey.csv</a>
  - <a href="data/classmethoddata.csv">random rectangles class data</a>
